physical_object.name: spiral-bound graph paper notebook with handwritten notes

assignments.utilization_method: Grab the notebook by the spiral binding with your fist wrapped fully around the wire spine. The stack of pages forms a broad, weighty ‘head’ that sticks out from your grip. Swinging it produces a clear moment of inertia because the paper mass lags and then follows through, echoing the feel of a hammer’s metal head. Lightly tapping the page block against your other palm gives a firm, sudden stop that reinforces the impact sensation.

physical_object.name: black mechanical computer keyboard with function keys

assignments.utilization_method: Use one of the larger keys (e.g., the space-bar or Enter key) as the press surface. Rest your index finger on that key and push straight down until the key bottoms out. The key’s built-in switch and return spring give a clear travel distance, progressive resistance, an audible click, and automatic rebound—closely mimicking the feel of depressing and releasing the virtual red button.
